definitions.definition: The quality (positive or negative) that renders something desirable or valuable.
definitions.example: The Shakespearean Shylock is of dubious value in the modern world.

definitions.definition: The degree of importance given to something.
definitions.example: The value of my children's happiness is second only to that of my wife.

definitions.definition: That which is valued or highly esteemed, such as one's morals, morality, or belief system.
definitions.example: He does not share his parents' values.

definitions.definition: The amount (of money or goods or services) that is considered to be a fair equivalent for something else.
The relative duration of a musical note.
definitions.example: The value of a crotchet is twice that of a quaver.

definitions.definition: The relative darkness or lightness of a color in (a specific area of) a painting etc.
Any definite numerical quantity or other mathematical object, determined by being measured, computed, or otherwise defined.
definitions.example: The exact value of pi cannot be represented in decimal notation.
the value of a word; the value of a legal instrument

definitions.definition: (in the plural) The valuable ingredients to be obtained by treating a mass or compound; specifically, the precious metals contained in rock, gravel, etc.
To estimate the value of; judge the worth of something.
definitions.example: I will have the family jewels valued by a professional.

definitions.definition: To fix or determine the value of; assign a value to, as of jewelry or art work.
To regard highly; think much of; place importance upon.
definitions.example: Gold was valued highly among the Romans.
